Sigma notation.
Sigma notation is a mathematical notation to write long sums in a short way. Sigma notation uses the Greek letter Sigma (formula_1), and takes upper and lower bounds which tell us where the sum begins and where it ends. The lower bound usually has a variable (called the index, often denoted by formula_1, formula_1 or formula_1) along with a value, such as "formula_1". This tells us that the summation begins at 2, and goes up by 1 until it reaches the number on the top.
